# calendar

**Instance Property**

The calendar to use for the date picker.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var calendar: Calendar! { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default value of this property corresponds to the user’s current calendar as configured in Settings. This is equivalent to the value returned by calling the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSCalendar] class method [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSCalendar/current]. Setting this property to `nil` is equivalent to setting it to its default value.

Calendars specify the details of cultural systems used for reckoning time; they identify the beginning, length, and divisions of a year.

## Managing the date and calendar

- **date**: The date displayed by the date picker.
- **locale**: The locale used by the date picker.
- **setDate(_:animated:)**: Sets the date to display in the date picker, with an option to animate the setting.
- **timeZone**: The time zone reflected in the date displayed by the date picker.
